headline: Have you spotted the Orionid meteor shower?
text: Local weather conditions permitting, the next few days are the prime time for spotting the Orionid meteor shower. The Orionids, formed from the debris of Halleys comet, are so called as the area of the sky they appear to come from is a region to the north of constellation Orions bright star Betelgeuse. If youre staying up late (or getting up early) and are lucky enough to spot the Orionids, wed love to see your photos here at GuardianWitness.
